title: 2 suspects sought after mid-morning shooting in New Iberia
content:
NEW IBERIA — Iberia Parish Sheriff’s deputies are currently looking for two suspects who allegedly opened fire on a group of people, injuring one.
The shooting happened around 11:25 a.m. in the 600 block of Hopkins Street, KLFY reports.
Captain Wendell Raborn said “two black males wearing hoodies” approached a group of young men and opened fire on them for unknown reasons.
An 18-year-old male was hit in the leg and was taken to a local hospital to be treated for non-life threatening injuries.
Anyone with any information about the suspects or the shooting is asked to call the Iberia Parish Sheriff’s Office at 337-369-3711.
